column9: My neuropathy in my leg eased up considerably after I combined it with exercise.

column2: Bluehair, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I take tis for peripheral neuropathy AND restless legs syndrome and it works perfectly.  (My neuropathy is due to Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease, a genetic disorder.) I find it works just as well as Metanx, and is cheaper!  I was taking Neurontin (Gabapentin) but had to stop due to very dangerous drug interaction with Morphine. Neurpath-B is roughly one third tne cost of Gabapentin, the dose is much lower, no conflict with any of my meds, I have experienced no side effects, and it is weight-neutral, unlike Gabapentin (which caused gradual gain of 70 pounds over one and one-half years despite a low-cal healthy diet.) I'm sold!
